Subject: Parameter settings for comparing HyperNEAT to P-NEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211599040; y=qwti2Pn3XicnADLAkKSbAmu-hUkTPj6lgRqRn0VfzwxJ1HrFdW9u
X-Yahoo-Profile: jeffreyclune

Hi all-

A quick question for Ken, Jason and Dave.

I notice that most of the parameter settings (e.g.
MutateLinkWeightsProbability) were the same when you guys compared HyperNEAT
to P-NEAT. 

Someone in my lab raised the issue yesterday that each configuration may
have entirely different optimal settings, making a comparison with the same
settings potentially unfair. Out of curiosity, did you do any parameter
sweeps to see if P-NEAT's performance did much better, and better approached
HyperNEAT's, with different parameter settings?

For example, since mutations to HyperNEAT have such larger effects on the
final substrate, it could be argued that P-NEAT needs a much higher mutation
rate to compete.

Note: I don't think P-NEAT will beat HyperNEAT no matter what the settings,
but I do think the question is fair and I would not be surprised if the
settings that worked great for HyperNEAT are not the ones that work great
for P-NEAT (and vice versa). In short, I am confident that the qualitative
results of your paper are still all valid (and represent breakthroughs for
the field), but am interested to know whether the quantitative difference
between the encodings might be much less with different settings.

PS. As a side note, there are a ton of settings and sweeping them all is
nearly impossible, especially when considering interactions. What does
everyone in the group consider to be the important ones to sweep?




Cheers,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University

jclune@...
